snippet: With an estimated 11,000 homes destroyed and many more severely damaged, Gaza’s housing and humanitarian troubles are just beginning.
abstract: Some 11,000 Palestinian homes have been destroyed, and many more severely damaged, in Gaza during fierce month of fighting between Israel and Palestinian militants; destruction creates housing and humanitarian crisis that is only beginning, as residents band together in whatever shelter they can find; uncertainty over timing and terms for a durable truce makes recovery planning elusive.
lead_paragraph: With an estimated 11,000 homes destroyed and many more severely damaged, Gaza’s housing and humanitarian troubles are just beginning.

headline.main: In Torn Gaza, if Roof Stands, It’s Now Home
headline.print_headline: In Torn Gaza, if Roof Stands, It’s Now Home

keywords.value: United Nations Relief and Works Agency
